adjectives.description: incommodious (comparative more incommodious, superlative most incommodious)

entries.meaning: (of a place occupied by people) Uncomfortable or inhospitable, especially due to being cramped.
examples: In this they succeeded last week, despite menacing clouds and slick pavement, filling to capacity (and until past midnight) the 1937 building’s incommodious terrace with a mostly young and fairly international crowd.
